bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Crawford G. Cheney (1855-1931) was born in Zanzibar, East Africa. He came to this country as a boy and lived in Essex, CT the rest of his life. Known as a successful businessman and philanthropist, he was vice-president and a director of the Comstock, Cheney & Co., president and director of the Essex National Bank, and president and director of the Essex Library Association. He married Harriet Stevenson and had one sone, Wallace Cheney. He was the son of George Arthur Cheney and Sarah Brecklin Greene Cheney.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This small collection of photographs and objects were saved by Julia Livingston Hunt. (They may have been partial contents of a desk.) Only a few of the photographs are identified. Small photos and news clippings are of family members, some of â??The Bramblesâ?? summer home in York Harbor, Maine. Wooden African boxes, ivory items and a small painting relate to Rufus Greene & Co., ivory buyers, for whom Crawford worked for a period. Also included are personal and business correspondence; sketches; realia.
